p: BICP, a leader in the delivery of innovative data analytics & science products for large enterprise customers is hiring a Data Scientist to join our data products delivery team at a Fortune 100 retail client in Portland, OR. Our DS will be part of a Data Products Delivery squad focused primarily on delivering new insights associated with Fulfillment & Supply Chain metrics. Data Scientist will assist in the definition of new insights based on stakeholder specifications, scope and estimate ROI for each opportunity and scale systems to enable the delivery of these existing & new data products. We are looking for candidates with excellent communication, interpersonal and documentation skills in addition to proven success collaborating effectively with key business stakeholders we well as highly technical development teams. Ideal candidates will have deep SQL expertise with end-to-end data experience including discovery, extraction, manipulation, blending, and visualization.
p.2: We are looking for smart, analytical people with a unique blend of technical aptitude and the polish required to partner with the business and deliver accurate and meaningful insights. The key quality we are looking for is adaptability =E2=80=93 we=E2=80=99re seeking those who have a desire and passion for learning new technologies and the acumen to ramp up new tools quickly. We are looking to hire self-starters that can thrive in a highly autonomous, Agile environment and willing to perform any task that will help 'move the ball down court'.

li: Support the expansion of our Lifetime Value Model (LTV) to include supply chain metrics and variables.
li.1: Use data to predicts trends and perform statistical analysis that can identify correlations and patterns between Supply chain Metrics (Split Shipment rate, Delivery Satisfaction, Carrier Performance, ETC.)
li.2: Assist in conducting Adhoc analysis & data needs, business case development, & deliverable creation
li.3: Establish a easy functional way to conduct A/B analysis for testing using Optimizly
li.4: Develop SQL queries and data visualizations to fulfill ad-hoc analysis requests and ongoing reporting needs leveraging standard query syntax

strong: What you bring to the table:

li.4: Experience in establishing and quantifying LTV
li.5: An understanding of advanced analytics techniques is an advantage; preferably competent with statistical packages such as R, Python, SPSS, SAS, etc., as well as experience with statistical modeling and clustering techniques (Regression, Logistic Regression, Random Forest, K-means)

p.13: We are looking to hire the Data Scientist immediately and compensation includes a competitive hourly rate, PTO and health benefits. Our Data Scientist will be onsite Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and remote Monday & Friday in Beaverton, Oregon.
p.16: ***Corp to Corp candidates are not eligible for this role.
p.20: BICP is a consulting firm focused on delivering innovative Analytics + Hyperscale platform solutions to our customers. With deep experience across a diverse ecosystem analytical products and cloud-based platforms we have the required product ambiguity and expertise to deliver best in breed solutions tailored to our client=E2=80=99s critical business data needs.
p.22: BICP is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.
